article_title: See four shows for as little as $136
article_text:
01:20 Cellist Amit Peled critiques New World School of the Arts students Pause

01:18 How hard is the National Spelling Bee preliminary test?

01:58 A look back at Obama’s visit to Vietnam

04:09 TSA Administrator says summer will be better for airport security lines

03:43 PAMM announces gift of 100 artworks by developer Craig Robins

01:28 Florida Highway Patrol fatal shooting in Miami Gardens

article_metadata.news-keywords: Arsht Center, Miami, Broadway, Affordable Arts, Phantom of the Opera, Kinky Boots, Motown the Musical, Cabaret
article_metadata.description: Broadway tickets can be expensive, very expensive, as anyone trying to score one to Hamilton knows all too well. But seeing the touring version of a Broadway show is more affordable, and Miami’s Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts has a four-show subscription deal that costs less than an orchestra seat to a production on the Great White Way.
article_metadata.title: See four shows for as little as $136 | Miami Herald
